sen.j: 宮津県（みやづけん）は廃藩置県により1871年（明治4年）に設置された県。
sen.e: Miyazu Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1871 based on the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
Miyazu Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1871 based on the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
Miyazu Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1871 based on the policy of Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).

sen.j: 同年10月に豊岡県に統合され消滅した。
sen.e: It was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture in the same year.
It was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture in the same year.
It was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture in the same year.

sen.j: 県域は現在の宮津市や与謝郡に設置されていた。
sen.e: The prefecture covered current Miyazu City and Yosa-gun.
The prefecture covered current day Miyazu City and Yosa-gun.
The prefecture covered current day Miyazu City and Yosa County.
History
History
History

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）7月14日：廃藩置県により宮津藩（7万石）が宮津県として発足。
sen.e: July 14, 1871: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken, Miyazu han (70,000 koku) was reorganized as Miyazu Prefecture.
July 14, 1871: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken, Miyazu han (70,000 koku) was reorganized as Miyazu Prefecture.
July 14, 1871: Under the policy of Haihan-chiken, Miyazu Domain (70,000 koku) was reorganized as Miyazu Prefecture.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）11月22日：豊岡県に統合
sen.e: November 22, 1871: It was consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
November 22, 1871: It was consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
November 22, 1871: It was consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）8月22日：豊岡県廃止により京都府へ編入。
sen.e: August 22, 1876: Toyooka Prefecture was abolished and incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture.
August 22, 1876: Toyooka Prefecture was abolished and incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture.
August 22, 1876: Toyooka Prefecture was abolished and incorporated into Kyoto Prefecture.
